text:
This question is based on General Literary Principles.

A literary work in which the characters and events are used as symbols is known as
explanation:
Anallegoryis a narrative or visual representation in which a character, place, or event can be interpreted to represent a hidden meaning with moral or political significance.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Principles.

Characterization in a novel refers to the

options.B: way the characters are revealed to the reader
options.C: characters and the way they behave

explanation:
Characterization is the way an author or an actor describes or shows what a character is like.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Principles.

In literary work, verbal irony refers to a

options.A: device in which the speaker means the opposite of what he says
options.B: situation in which a character speaks or acts against the trend of events
options.C: difficult situation which defies a logical or rational resolution
options.D: device in which the actor on stage means exactly what he says

explanation:
Verbal irony occurs when a speaker says one thing while meaning another, resulting in an ironic clash between their intended meaning and their literal meaning. Most types of verbal irony can be classified as either overstatement or understatement.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Principles.

In the theatre, words spoken by a character that are meant to be heard by the audience but not by the other characters on stage is called
explanation:
An aside is a dramatic device in which a character speaks to the audience. By convention, the audience is to realize that the character's speech is unheard by the other characters on stage.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Principles.

Drama is the representation of a complete series of actions by means of

options.A: movement and gesture for the screen and audience
options.B: speech, movement and gesture for the stage only
options.C: speech, movement and gesture for the stage, screen and radio
options.D: speech, gesture and movement for the screen and radio

explanation:
Drama is a play for theatre, radio, or television.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Principles.

A poet's use of regular rhythm is known as
explanation:
Metre is the basic rhythmic structure of a line within a poem or poetic work.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Principles.

A literary genre which directly imitates human action is
explanation:
Drama is an imitation of human actions.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Principles.

A fable is a story in which

options.B: animals or things are used as characters
options.D: the story is told in poetic form

explanation:
A fable is narrative form, usuallyfeaturing animals that behave and speak as human beings,
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Principles.

The juxtaposition of two contrasting ideas in a line of poetry is
explanation:
Oxymoron is placing side by side two contradictory words.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Principles.

The main aim of caricature is to
explanation:
Caricature is a picture, description, or imitation of a person in which certain striking characteristics are exaggerated in order to create a comic or grotesque effect.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Appreciation.

O! Ceremony,show me but thy worth What is thy soul of adoration

The figure of speech in the lines above is
explanation:
An apostrophe is a literary device in which the speaker addresses either an absent person or a non-human object, idea, or being.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Appreciation.

"What eyes will watch our large mouths
Shaped by the laughter of big children
What eyes will watch our large mouths?"

Birage Diop:Vanity

The tone of the lines above is one of
explanation:
Sarcasm is an ironic or satirical remark tempered by humour.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Appreciation.

The old man slept in his favourite chair
The wind ran its fingers through his hair
He looked like a tree gone dry of sap
And his hands were dry upon his lap

The rhyme scheme of the poem above is
explanation:
chair (a)
hair (a)
sap (b)
lap (b)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Appreciation.

Unequal laws unto a savage race,
That board, and sleep, and feed....

The lines above show that the speaker

options.D: knows much of his city men

explanation:
Unequal laws unto a savage race imply a discrimination on the grounds of race
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Appreciation.

....How can i look at Oyo and say i
hate long shiny cars? How can i
come to the children and despise
international schools?
And Koomson comes, and the
family sees Jesus Christ in him....

The feeling conveyed by the speaker above is one of
explanation:
Despair is the complete loss or absence of hope.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Appreciation.

"Hide me now, when night children haunt the earth"
Wole Soyinka:Night

Night children in the stanza above reflects the consciousness of
explanation:
Night children suggest several possibilities; the insects and animals whose cries make the night terrifying, armed robbers who work under the covering of night, evil forces or spiritual beings which are believed to operate at night. However, the poet uses the word 'haunt' which primarily pertains to a ghost of spirits.
'Spirit beings' is therefore the best answer.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Appreciation.

"Serrated shadows, through dark leaves
Til, bathed in warm suffusion of your 
dapped cells
Sensation pained me, faceless, silent
as night thieves."
                              Wole Soyinka: Night

The dominant mood in the lines above is one of
explanation:
click here
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Appreciation.


"The drums overwhelmed the guns..."

J.P Clark: Casualties

The poet in the excerpt above uses
explanation:
The drum symbolizes Africans and the guns symbolizes the British

text:
This question is based on General Literary Appreciation.

....They do not see the funeral piles
At home eating up the forests..."

J.P. Clark:Casualties

The imagery created in the above excerpt is achieved through
explanation:
personification is when a thing is represented as a human being.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Appreciation.

"I cannot rest from travel: I will
drink
Life to the lees, all times I have
enjoyed
Greatly, have suffered greatly"
A.L. Tennyson:Ulysses

The lines above inform the reader that the poet
explanation:
The poet persona is inspired to travel more, even though he had suffered greatly from past travels he feels fulfilled travelling and wants to get the most of it.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

"We would be believing we dreamt it"

The figure of speech in the line above from Acquah's In the Navel of the Soul is
explanation: Assonanceis the repetition of vowel sounds within words. In the line:"We would be believing we dreamt it all", The /i:/ soundappears in "we","be" and"believing"; and the /i/ sound in  "believing" and"it". This repetition of vowel sounds is a clear example ofassonance.
